content.question: Which of the following correctly depicts the nuclear chain reaction that occurs in a nuclear power plant?

choices.label: The figure presents a neutron with an arrow drawn to an atom. The atom has two arrows, each pointing to an electron. Each electron has an arrow that points to a different atom. The second atoms each have two arrows, pointing to an electron.

The figure presents a neutron with an arrow drawn to an atom. The atom has two arrows, each pointing to a neutron. Each neutron has an arrow that points to a different atom. The second atoms each have two arrows, pointing to a neutron.

The figure presents a neutron with an arrow drawn to an atom. The atom has three arrows; one arrow points to an electron, one arrow points to a neutron, and one arrow points to a proton. The electron and the neutron both have an arrow that point to a second atom. The second atom has three arrows pointing to electrons. The proton has an arrow that points to a third atom. The atom has three arrows pointing to protons.

The figure presents a neutron with an arrow drawn to an atom. The atom has two arrows, each pointing to a neutron. Each neutron has two arrows one that loops back to the first atom and a second arrow that points to a different atom. The second atoms each have two arrows, one pointing to an electron and one pointing to a neutron. The second atoms each have two arrows, pointing to an electron.

content.answer: The figure presents a neutron with an arrow drawn to an atom. The atom has two arrows, each pointing to a neutron. Each neutron has an arrow that points to a different atom. The second atoms each have two arrows, pointing to a neutron.
